title: Ticket #7772: Some condor_token_* commands have the same usage message
description:
These four commands

  • condor_token_fetch
  • condor_token_request
  • condor_token_request_approve
  • condor_token_request_list

all have the usage message

  Generates a token from a remote daemon and prints its contents to stdout.

which seems like the intended message for condor_token_request. It looks like we have real usage messages in the corresponding man pages; we should use the same ones here (though I would suggest that they all get a bit of love in the process).
remarks:
Some other things I've noticed while working with this API that should have notes in the usage information:

  • to request more than one authorization, you must pass them separately, like this: -authz READ -authz WRITE. There are examples of this in the man page, but it should be re-stated in the option description in condensed form.
  • If you are requesting a token from a daemon that is not a collector, you must pass -type as well as -name, or you will get a confusing error message.
